abstract.text: An object that creates matches with other players without presenting an interface to the players.

inlineContent.text: class to auto-match players for a quicker game start, programmatically invite specific players, or implement your own interface for players to invite other players. If you want to present a familiar matchmaking GameKit interface to players, instead use either the

If you host a game on your own server, you can also use this class to find Game Center players. That is, you implement the networking and communication between the players through your own servers not Game Center.
To find players using this class, create a
object and configure it according to the parameters of your game. Then, pass the match request and a handler using the
method for hosted games, to the shared
GameKit calls the handler when players accept their invitations. Implement the handler to set the delegate of the
object that GameKit sends and start the game when there are enough players.
If the match doesn’t have enough players (for example, some players decline their invitations), you can create another match request and call the
property is zero. When you have enough players to start the match, call the
method to end the matchmaking process.
If you provide a SharePlay interface for inviting players, use the
methods to create a group activity on behalf of the player.

abstract.text: Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
An invitation to join a match sent to the local player from another player.
A protocol that handles invite events from Game Center.
A peer-to-peer network between a group of players that sign into Game Center.
The remaining number of players invited but not yet connected to the match.
An object that encapsulates the parameters to create a real-time or turn-based match.
An object that represents matchmaking results, including the players that join the match and their properties that matchmaking rules uses.
An object that creates matches with other players without presenting an interface to the players.
Invites additional players to an existing match.
Cancels a matchmaking request.
Cancels a pending invitation to another player.
Initiates a request to find players for a peer-to-peer match.
Initiates a request to find players for a hosted match that uses matchmaking rules.
Initiates a request to find players for a hosted match.
Initiates a request to find players for a hosted match.
Informs the server when programmatic matchmaking finishes.
Creates a match from an invitation that the local player accepts.
Finds the number of players, across player groups, who recently requested a match.
Finds the number of players in a player group who recently requested a match.
Finds the number of players in a specific queue who recently requested a match.
Returns the singleton matchmaker instance.
Finds nearby players through Bluetooth or WiFi on the same subnet.
Begins a SharePlay activity for your game when a FaceTime call is active.
Stops finding nearby players.
Ends a SharePlay activity for the entire group, which the local player activates.
An interface that allows a player to invite other players to a real-time game and automatch to fill any empty slots.
An interface that allows a player to invite other players to a turn-based match and automatch to fill any empty slots.
Enable players to voice chat with all, or groups of, players in a multiplayer game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Adding voice chat to multiplayer games

abstract.text: Develop games where multiple players interact in real time.
Send data between players in a real-time multiplayer game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Exchanging data between players in real-time games

abstract.text: Discover and invite other players to participate in a real-time game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Finding multiple players for a game

abstract.text: Add a rule to find players in a range of skill levels to balance competitive gameplay.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Finding players with similar skill levels

abstract.text: Game Center applies different type of rules you create in a particular order to find the best matches.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
